subject: RE: [junit] Integrating JUNIT with Visual Age
msgSnippet: ... It shouldn t. ... Agreed. ... This is confusing.  Look at the contents of junit.jar outside of VAJ and verify that they are source files (Winzip. or jar
messageBody:
> Background
> 1.The VAJ that Iam using is the freeware. Does this matter?

It shouldn't.

> 2.I have been using JUNIT successfully, it would be
> really nice not to have to debug with print statements!

Agreed.

> 3.I'm totally new to VAJ
>
> If this works I'll get a cut of the real thing.
>
> I blew away the project and started from scratch.
>
> Per step one. I started importing stuff. If I only
> imported the source I could view it. But after I imported
> junit.jar I wasn't.

This is confusing. Look at the contents of junit.jar outside of VAJ and
verify that they are source files (Winzip. or "jar -tvf junit.jar" on the
command line - making sure that java is in your path of course)

> Sorry but I don't understand step two

Under your install directory you will find /ide/tools. Under there create a
directory like /org-junit. In that directory, create a file called
'default.ini' with the following info:

Name=JUnit
Version=<version number>
Menu-Items=\
JUnit Swing,junit.swingui.TestRunner, ;\
JUnit Swing,junit.swingui.TestRunner,-c \
JUnit AWT,junit.awtui.TestRunner, ;\
JUnit AWT,junit.awtui.TestRunner,-c \
JUnit Text,junit.textui.TestRunner, ;\
JUnit Text,junit.textui.TestRunner,-c \

Pick up from there.

HTH.

-Jason
